title: Temporal processing in the auditory system from cochlea to cortex
abstractText:
Presentations at public meetings: Professor Moore has made several presentations at meetings intended to provide the general public with up to date information about hearing impairment and hearing aids.
 
Radio broadcasts and popular articles: Professor Moore has been interviewed on BBC radio several times in connection with aspects of hearing, hearing impairment and hearing aids. He has written several educational leaflets on hearing aids, cochlear implants and hearing impairment, which are used by charities such as the Royal National Institute for Deaf People and Defeating Deafness. He has also written educational articles for ?Wavelength?, the newsletter of the Association of Independent Hearing Healthcare Professionals, and for the newsletter of the British Society of Hearing Aid Audiologists. Dr Carlyon and Professor Plack participated in a Radio 4 discussion programme about hearing, and both have been involved in interactive hearing experiments on Radio 5 Live. In collaboration with the sound artist Kate Tierney, Professor Plack has given a presentation at the Institute of Contemporary Arts, and exhibitions at the Lux Gallery and the Greenwich and Docklands Festival.. Professor Patterson presented the scientific case for the fire station warnings in a video used to introduce firemen to the new system, and he participated in promoting the project in the press.
